c-0: ^I just wanted to say hi to you, but now I'm worried. Did I do something?
c-1: ^I was hoping that you could change your face out there to not look like you want to attack the audience?

C1: ^Sorry, force of habit. Usually when you come to me you need help with something mundane because you're too lazy to do it yourself.

c-0: ^Ouch! So no confidence in me then? I'll just have to prove you wrong then.
^Good luck with that. You're gonna have to do a lot better than what you're doing out there.
c-1: ^Okay, I get it. You don't have any confidence in me and my ability to help. But I'm trying to change that by helping you guys here.
^Well you haven't had much luck in the past, you know? I don't want you giving up on us or screwing up because it means a lot to us.
^And it means a lot to me. So don't screw us over.

C2: ^HEY! One of them was looking at me funny and I didn't appreciate it. Don't diss me for that. He got what he deserved.

c-0: ^Actually? That's kinda messed up. Could you just try to ignore him then?
^I was trying to, but every time we made eye-contact he made a stupid face. It's difficult to not look at him now that I know he's there.
c-1: ^What if you made a funny face back to them instead?
^It shows that they aren't getting a rise out of you, unlike the "I will fight you" face you were doing earlier.
